newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Notionnel bull run falters, target 129.66.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Notionnel bull run falters, target 129.66.

text.p: The June notionnel future on MATIF will struggle to make any headway on Thursday and is facing a period of consolidation with a floor at 129.66, technical analysts said.
With the contract's Relative Strength Index still in overbought, the notionnel's recent bull run appears to be running out of steam, they said.
Guenter Redeker, technical analyst at Chase in London, said a break below 130.56 may mean a test of 130.37, then 130.24.
"Below that we've got more severe support at 129.66, which is the lower boundary of the upper trend channel," he said.
By 0821 GMT, the June notionnel was down 0.01 at 130.54.
On the upside, Redeker said the market faced initial resistance at 130.74, then a key barrier at weekly trendline resistance at 130.84.
"To improve the outlook for the notionnel, we must have a daily closing above 130.84," he said, adding 131.10 then 131.48 were the next targets.
Charts show the market hit a daily high of 131.48 on February 28, just prior to breaking down.
Richard Adcock, technical research manager at HSBC Futures, said he had toned down his bullish view.
"We are looking for a long overdue consolidation to develop taking the market back to 129.66, which we set as our next target point," he said in a note for clients.
By 0836 GMT, June Pibor was down four basis points at 96.52. Analysts said the market may try to push higher in the next few weeks and recommended short term weakness be used as a buying opportunity.
